sections.heading: 2. COURSE DESCRIPTIONS
content: The course on Development of Open Source Software and Applications is designed to provide students with comprehensive insights into various aspects of open source software. It covers fundamental concepts associated with open source software, explores licensing considerations, and highlights the advantages of leveraging open source solutions in application development. Students will gain exposure to popular open source software utilized across different application development domains, including programming languages, database management systems, web servers, content management systems, and enterprise resource planning tools. Additionally, the course introduces students to prominent open source application development environments like Eclipse IDE, Apache NetBeans and Visual Studio Code, fostering a practical understanding of software development in open source ecosystems.

content: Students are responsible for attending all classes. In case of absence from school due to force majeure reasons, sufficient and reasonable proofs must be provided. For each absence, 1 point will be deducted 1 point. Students who miss any classes more than 3 times, with or without reason, will be considered as failing to complete the course and have to re-register.
Students will be awarded points for constructive comments these points are added to attendance points and group assignments.

content: The course is conducted on the principle of respecting learners and lecturers. Any behaviour that affects the teaching and learning process is strictly prohibited.

Laptops and tablets are only used for the purpose of taking notes for and calculating for lectures and exercises, absolutely forbidden to use for other purposes.
